content: mongooseä»‹ç» mongoose æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæ ‡å‡†çš„ C è¯­è¨€ç½‘ç»œé€šä¿¡æ¨¡å—ï¼Œæ˜¯åµŒå…¥å¼ç½‘ç»œç¼–ç¨‹çš„ç‘å£«å†›åˆ€ã€‚mongoose æä¾›éé˜»å¡çš„äº‹ä»¶é©±åŠ¨çš„ TCP, UDP, HTTP, WebSocket, CoAP, MQTT çš„æœåŠ¡ç«¯ä¸å®¢æˆ·ç«¯æ¨¡å¼çš„APIsã€‚ mongoose ä¸»è¦åŒ…å«å¦‚ä¸‹åŠŸèƒ½ï¼š Cross-platform: works on Linux/UNIX, MacOS, QNX, eCos, Windows, Android, iPhone, FreeRTOS (TI CC3200, ESP8266), etc Supported hardware platforms: TI CC3200, TI MSP432, NRF52, STM32, PIC32, ESP8266, ESP32 and more Builtin protocols: plain TCP, plain UDP, SSL/TLS (over TCP, one-way or two-way) HTTP client, HTTP server WebSocket client, WebSocket server MQTT client, MQTT broker CoAP client, CoAP server DNS client, DNS server, async DNS resolver Single-threaded, asynchronous, non-blocking core with simple event-based API Native support forÂ PicoTCP embedded TCP/IP stack,Â LWIP embedded TCP/IP stack Tiny static and run-time footprint Source code is both ISO C and ISO C++ compliant Very easy to integrate: just copyÂ mongoose.cÂ andÂ mongoose.hÂ files to your build tree

content: mongooseä½¿ç”¨ mongoose åŸºæœ¬æ•°æ®ç»“æ„ struct mg_mgr ç®¡ç†æ‰€æœ‰æ´»åŠ¨çš„è¿æ¥ struct mg_connection ç”¨äºæè¿°å’Œç»´æŠ¤ä¸€ä¸ªconnectionè¿æ¥ struct mbuf ç®¡ç†å’Œç»´æŠ¤å‘é€/æ¥æ”¶çš„æ•°æ®ç¼“å†²åŒº mongoose ä½¿ç”¨ç¤ºä¾‹ // declare and initialise event manager struct mg_mgr mgr; mg_mgr_init(&mgr, NULL); // Create connections // For example, a server application should create listening connections struct mg_connection *c = mg_bind(&mgr, "80", ev_handler_function); mg_set_protocol_http_websocket(c); // create an event loop by calling mg_mgr_poll() in a loop for (;;) { mg_mgr_poll(&mgr, 1000); }

content: Memory buffers æ¯ä¸ªconnectionè¿æ¥éƒ½æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªæ•°æ®å‘é€ç¼“å†²åŒºï¼ˆstruct mg_connection::send_mbufï¼‰ä¸æ•°æ®æ¥æ”¶ç¼“å†²åŒºï¼ˆstruct mg_connection::recv_mbufï¼‰ã€‚å½“æ¥æ”¶åˆ°æ•°æ®æ—¶ï¼Œmongooseå°†æ•°æ®æ·»åŠ åˆ°recv_mbufï¼Œå¹¶è§¦å‘recv_mbufÂ äº‹ä»¶æ¶ˆæ¯ï¼›å½“mongooseå‘é€æ•°æ®åï¼Œå°†å·²å‘é€çš„æ•°æ®ä»struct mg_connection::send_mbufÂ ä¸­æŠ›å¼ƒï¼Œå¹¶è§¦å‘MG_EV_SENDÂ äº‹ä»¶æ¶ˆæ¯ï¼›å½“connectionè¿æ¥å…³é—­æ—¶ï¼Œå°†å‘é€MG_EV_CLOSEÂ äº‹ä»¶æ¶ˆæ¯ã€‚
title: mongooseä»‹ç»

content: Event handler Event handler functionçš„å¤„ç†ç¤ºä¾‹å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š static void ev_handler(struct ns_connection *nc, int ev, void *p) { switch (ev) { case NS_ACCEPT: case NS_CONNECT: // Do something break; case NS_CLOSE: // close event break; case NS_RECV: // data received break; default: break; } } ä¸»è¦å‚æ•°è¯´æ˜å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š struct mg_connection *nc æ”¶åˆ°æ•°æ®å¯¹åº”çš„connection int ev Event numberï¼Œè¯·å‚è€ƒã€Šmongooseæ”¯æŒçš„Eventåˆ—è¡¨ã€‹ void *p æ¥æ”¶åˆ°çš„æ•°æ®çš„æŒ‡é’ˆï¼Œä¸åŒæ¶ˆæ¯è¯¥å‚æ•°æœ‰ä¸åŒçš„å«ä¹‰ mongooseæ”¯æŒçš„Eventåˆ—è¡¨ï¼š MG_EV_ACCEPT: sent when a new server connection is accepted by a listening connection.Â void *ev_dataÂ isÂ union socket_addressÂ of the remote peer. MG_EV_CONNECT: sent when a new outbound connection created byÂ mg_connect()Â either failed or succeeded.Â void *ev_dataÂ isÂ int *success. IfÂ successÂ is 0, then the connection has been established, otherwise it contains an error code. SeeÂ mg_connect_opt()Â function for code example. MG_EV_RECV: New data is received and appended to the end ofÂ recv_mbuf.Â void *ev_dataÂ isÂ int *num_received_bytes. Typically, event handler should check received data inÂ nc->recv_mbuf, discard processed data by callingÂ mbuf_remove(), set connection flagsÂ nc->flagsÂ if necessary (seeÂ structmg_connection) and write data the remote peer by output functions likeÂ mg_send(). WARNING: Mongoose usesÂ realloc()Â to expand the receive buffer. It is the userâ€™s responsibility to discard processed data from the beginning of the receive buffer, note theÂ mbuf_remove()Â call in the example above. MG_EV_SEND: Mongoose has written data to the remote peer and discarded written data from theÂ mg_connection::send_mbuf.Â void *ev_dataÂ isÂ int*num_sent_bytes. NOTE: Mongoose output functions only append data to theÂ mg_connection::send_mbuf. They do not do any socket writes. An actual IO is done byÂ mg_mgr_poll(). AnÂ MG_EV_SENDÂ event is just a notification about an IO has been done. MG_EV_POLL: Sent to all connections on each invocation ofÂ mg_mgr_poll(). This event could be used to do any housekeeping, for example check whether a certain timeout has expired and closes the connection or send heartbeat message, etc. MG_EV_TIMER: Sent to the connection ifÂ mg_set_timer()Â was called.
title: mongooseä»‹ç»

content: Using SSL on TCP SSL_CERT PEM format certificate. For listening connections, certificate file must contain private key and server certificate concatenated together; For client connections, it should be a client certificate file. CA_CERT PEM format certificate. A certificate authority (CA) PEM file, and it is optional (can be set to NULL). If ca_cert is non-NULL, then the connection is so-called two-way-SSL: other peerâ€™s certificate is checked against the ca_cert. int main(void) { struct mg_mgr mgr; struct mg_connection *c; struct mg_bind_opts bind_opts; mg_mgr_init(&mgr, NULL); memset(&bind_opts, 0, sizeof(bind_opts)); bind_opts.ssl_cert = "cert.pem"; bind_opts.ssl_key = "key.pem"; // Use bind_opts to specify SSL certificate & key file c = mg_bind_opt(&mgr, "443", ev_handler, bind_opts); mg_set_protocol_http_websocket(c); ... } SSLè¯ä¹¦ç”Ÿæˆæ–¹å¼ï¼š # @see: https://www.openssl.org/docs/manmaster/man1/openssl-req.html openssl req -nodes -x509 -newkey rsa:2048 -keyout key.pem -out cert.pem -days 9999
title: mongooseä»‹ç»

content: Usage $ clang-format -help OVERVIEW: A tool to format C/C++/Java/JavaScript/Objective-C/Protobuf code. If no arguments are specified, it formats the code from standard input and writes the result to the standard output. If <file>s are given, it reformats the files. If -i is specified together with <file>s, the files are edited in-place. Otherwise, the result is written to the standard output. USAGE: clang-format [options] [<file> ...] OPTIONS: Clang-format options: -assume-filename=<string> - When reading from stdin, clang-format assumes this filename to look for a style config file (with -style=file) and to determine the language. -cursor=<uint> - The position of the cursor when invoking clang-format from an editor integration -dump-config - Dump configuration options to stdout and exit. Can be used with -style option. -fallback-style=<string> - The name of the predefined style used as a fallback in case clang-format is invoked with -style=file, but can not find the .clang-format file to use. Use -fallback-style=none to skip formatting. -i - Inplace edit <file>s, if specified. -length=<uint> - Format a range of this length (in bytes). Multiple ranges can be formatted by specifying several -offset and -length pairs. When only a single -offset is specified without -length, clang-format will format up to the end of the file. Can only be used with one input file. -lines=<string> - <start line>:<end line> - format a range of lines (both 1-based). Multiple ranges can be formatted by specifying several -lines arguments. Can't be used with -offset and -length. Can only be used with one input file. -offset=<uint> - Format a range starting at this byte offset. Multiple ranges can be formatted by specifying several -offset and -length pairs. Can only be used with one input file. -output-replacements-xml - Output replacements as XML. -sort-includes - Sort touched include lines -style=<string> - Coding style, currently supports: LLVM, Google, Chromium, Mozilla, WebKit. Use -style=file to load style configuration from .clang-format file located in one of the parent directories of the source file (or current directory for stdin). Use -style="{key: value, ...}" to set specific parameters, e.g.: -style="{BasedOnStyle: llvm, IndentWidth: 8}" -verbose - If set, shows the list of processed files Generic Options: -help - Display available options (-help-hidden for more) -help-list - Display list of available options (-help-list-hidden for more) -version - Display the version of this program åˆ›å»º.clang-formatæ–‡ä»¶ clang-format -style=google -dump-config > .clang-format
title: Clang format for C/C++/Java/JavaScript/Object-C

BasedOnStyle: LLVM IndentWidth: 4 --- Language: Cpp # Force pointers to the type for C++. DerivePointerAlignment: false PointerAlignment: Left --- Language: JavaScript # Use 100 columns for JS. ColumnLimit: 100 --- Language: Proto # Don't format .proto files. int b = 23; int ccc = 23; - **AlignConsecutiveDeclarations **_(bool)_ > å˜é‡å£°æ˜æ—¶æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦å¯¹é½ï¼Œå¦‚å½“è®¾ç½®ä¸ºtrueæ—¶ > ```cpp int aaaa = 12; float b = 23; std::string ccc = 23; AlignEscapedNewlines ä½¿ç”¨backslashes()æ¢è¡Œæ—¶()çš„è®¾ç½®æ–¹å¼ï¼ŒåŒ…æ‹¬ä¸å¯¹é½ã€å·¦å¯¹é½ã€å³å¯¹é½ **AlignOperands **(bool) è¡¨è¾¾å¼æˆ–è€…è¯­å¥æ‹†åˆ†ä¸ºå¤šè¡Œæ—¶çš„æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦å¯¹é½ int aaa = bbbbbbbbbbbbbbb + ccccccccccccccc; - **AlignTrailingComments **_(bool)_ > æ³¨é‡Šæ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦å¯¹é½ - **AllowAllParametersOfDeclarationOnNextLine **_(bool)_ > å¦‚ä½•å‡½æ•°å£°æ˜æ—¶åŒ…å«å¤šè¡Œï¼Œæ¯ä¸ªå‚æ•°æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦å•ç‹¬åˆ—ä¸€è¡Œ - **AllowShortBlocksOnASingleLine **_(bool)_ > ç®€å•è¯­å¥æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦å†™åœ¨ä¸€è¡Œã€‚ E.g., this allowsÂ `ifÂ (a)Â {Â return;Â }`Â to be put on a single line. - **AllowShortCaseLabelsOnASingleLine **_(bool)_ > caseæ ‡ç­¾æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦ä¿æŒåœ¨ä¸€è¡Œ ```cpp // true: // false: switch (a) { vs. switch (a) { case 1: x = 1; break; case 1: case 2: return; x = 1; } break; case 2: return; } AllowShortFunctionsOnASingleLine çŸ­å‡½æ•°æ˜¯å¦å¯ä»¥ä¿æŒåœ¨ä¸€è¡Œ **AllowShortIfStatementsOnASingleLine **(bool) ç®€å• if è¯­å¥æ˜¯å¦å¯ä»¥ä¿æŒåœ¨ä¸€è¡Œ **AllowShortLoopsOnASingleLine **(bool) ç®€å•å¾ªç¯è¯­å¥æ˜¯å¦å¯ä»¥ä¿æŒåœ¨ä¸€è¡Œ AlwaysBreakAfterReturnType æ•°æ®è¿”å›å€¼çš„å¯é€‰æ ¼å¼ AlwaysBreakTemplateDeclarations æ¨¡æ¿å£°æ˜æ—¶çš„æ¢è¡Œå¼æ · **BinPackArguments **(bool) å‡½æ•°è°ƒç”¨æ—¶å‚æ•°æ”¾åœ¨ä¸€è¡Œè¿˜æ˜¯æ¯ä¸ªå‚æ•°ä¸€è¡Œ **BinPackParameters **(bool) å‡½æ•°å£°æ˜æˆ–å®šä¹‰æ—¶å‚æ•°æ”¾åœ¨ä¸€è¡Œè¿˜æ˜¯æ¯ä¸ªå‚æ•°ä¸€è¡Œ BraceWrapping / BreakBeforeBraces å¤§æ‹¬å·çš„ä½¿ç”¨æ–¹å¼ **BreakBeforeTernaryOperators **(bool) ä¸‰å…ƒæ“ä½œç¬¦æ—¶æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦æ¢è¡Œ true: veryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryLongDescription ? firstValue : SecondValueVeryVeryVeryVeryLong; false: veryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryVeryLongDescription ? firstValue : SecondValueVeryVeryVeryVeryLong; BreakConstructorInitializers æ„é€ å‡½æ•°æˆå‘˜åˆå§‹åŒ–åˆ—è¡¨çš„çš„å¼æ ·é…ç½® BreakInheritanceList ç±»å¤šé‡ç»§æ‰¿æ—¶çˆ¶ç±»çš„å¼æ ·é…ç½® **BreakStringLiterals **(bool) æ˜¯å¦å…è®¸å¯¹å­—ç¬¦ä¸²è¿›è¡Œæ ¼å¼åŒ– **ColumnLimit **(unsigned) The column limit. A column limit ofÂ 0Â means that there is no column limit. In this case, clang-format will respect the inputâ€™s line breaking decisions within statements unless they contradict other rules. **CompactNamespaces **(bool) æ˜¯å¦å…è®¸namespaceæ‰“åŒ…åˆ°ä¸€è¡Œï¼Œæˆ–è€…æ¯ä¸ªnamespaceåˆ†è¡Œ true: namespace Foo { namespace Bar { }} false: namespace Foo { namespace Bar { } } ConstructorInitializerAllOnOneLineOrOnePerLine If the constructor initializers donâ€™t fit on a line, put each initializer on its own line. ConstructorInitializerIndentWidthÂ (unsigned) æ„é€ å‡½æ•°æˆå‘˜åˆå§‹åŒ–åˆ—è¡¨çš„ç¼©è¿›æ•°é‡ ContinuationIndentWidthÂ (unsigned) è¡Œç¼©è¿›æ•°é‡ Cpp11BracedListStyleÂ (bool) IfÂ true, format braced lists as best suited for C++11 braced lists. true: false: vector<int> x{1, 2, 3, 4}; vs. vector<int> x{ 1, 2, 3, 4 }; vector<T> x{{}, {}, {}, {}}; vector<T> x{ {}, {}, {}, {} }; f(MyMap[{composite, key}]); f(MyMap[{ composite, key }]); new int[3]{1, 2, 3}; new int[3]{ 1, 2, 3 }; DerivePointerAlignmentÂ (bool) &Â andÂ *çš„å¯¹é½æ–¹å¼ DisableFormatÂ (bool) æ˜¯å¦ç¦æ­¢ä»£ç æ ¼å¼åŒ– FixNamespaceCommentsÂ (bool) æ˜¯å¦è‡ªåŠ¨æ·»åŠ namespaceçš„ç»“æŸæ³¨é‡Š true: false: namespace a { vs. namespace a { foo(); foo(); } // namespace a; } IncludeBlocksÂ (IncludeBlocksStyle) Dependent on the value, multipleÂ #includeÂ blocks can be sorted as one and divided based on category. IndentCaseLabelsÂ (bool) case è¯­å¥æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦ç¼©è¿› false: true: switch (fool) { vs. switch (fool) { case 1: case 1: bar(); bar(); break; break; default: default: plop(); plop(); } } IndentPPDirectivesÂ (PPDirectiveIndentStyle) é¢„å¤„ç†æŒ‡ä»¤æˆ–å®çš„ç¼©è¿›æ–¹å¼ IndentWidthÂ (unsigned) è¡Œç¼©è¿›çš„å­—ç¬¦æ•°é‡ KeepEmptyLinesAtTheStartOfBlocksÂ (bool) æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦åœ¨ä»£ç æ®µå‰ä¿æŒç©ºè¡Œ true: false: if (foo) { vs. if (foo) { bar(); bar(); } } LanguageÂ (LanguageKind) æŒ‡å®šè¯­è¨€ç±»å‹ LK_NoneÂ (in configuration:Â None) Do not use. LK_CppÂ (in configuration:Â Cpp) Should be used for C, C++. LK_JavaÂ (in configuration:Â Java) Should be used for Java. LK_JavaScriptÂ (in configuration:Â JavaScript) Should be used for JavaScript. LK_ObjCÂ (in configuration:Â ObjC) Should be used for Objective-C, Objective-C++. LK_ProtoÂ (in configuration:Â Proto) Should be used for Protocol Buffers (https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/). LK_TableGenÂ (in configuration:Â Tabl

content: .clang-format é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ç¤ºä¾‹ # Style options please see https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormatStyleOptions.html # The number of columns to use for indentation IndentWidth: 4 --- Language: Cpp BasedOnStyle: Google # The extra indent or outdent of access modifiers, e.g. public AccessModifierOffset: -1 # æ‹¬å·ä¸­çš„å‚æ•°æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦å¯¹é½ AlignAfterOpenBracket: Align # è¿ç»­çš„èµ‹å€¼è¯­å¥æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦åœ¨'='å¤„å¯¹é½ AlignConsecutiveAssignments: true # è¿ç»­å£°æ˜çš„å˜æ›´æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦å¯¹é½ AlignConsecutiveDeclarations: false # Options for aligning backslashes in escaped newlines AlignEscapedNewlines: Left # æ“ä½œæ•°åŠä¸‰å…ƒæ“ä½œç¬¦å¯¹é½ AlignOperands: true # æ³¨é‡Šå¯¹é½ AlignTrailingComments: true # å‡½æ•°å£°æ˜è¿‡é•¿æ—¶æ˜¯å¦æ¯ä¸ªå‚æ•°ä½œä¸ºä¸€è¡Œå¤„ç† AllowAllParametersOfDeclarationOnNextLine: false # Allows contracting simple braced statements to a single line AllowShortBlocksOnASingleLine: false # caseå…³é”®å­—æ˜¯å¦ä¸è¯­å¥æ”¾åœ¨ä¸€è¡Œ AllowShortCaseLabelsOnASingleLine: false # å•è¯­å¥æˆ–çŸ­å‡½æ•°æ˜¯å¦å¯ä»¥æ”¾åœ¨ä¸€è¡Œ AllowShortFunctionsOnASingleLine: Inline # IF å•è¯­å¥ä»£ç æ˜¯å¦å¯ä»¥æ”¾åœ¨ä¸€è¡Œ AllowShortIfStatementsOnASingleLine: true # å•è¯­å¥å¾ªç¯ä½“æ˜¯å¦å¯ä»¥ä¸å¾ªç¯æ”¾åœ¨ä¸€è¡Œ AllowShortLoopsOnASingleLine: true # AlwaysBreakAfterDefinitionReturnType é€‰é¡¹å°†è¢«å¼ƒç”¨ AlwaysBreakAfterDefinitionReturnType: None # The function declaration return type breaking style to use AlwaysBreakAfterReturnType: None # å¤šè¡Œå­—ç¬¦ä¸²æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦å¦èµ·ä¸€è¡Œ AlwaysBreakBeforeMultilineStrings: true # æ¨¡æ¿å£°æ˜æ—¶æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦å¦èµ·ä¸€è¡Œ AlwaysBreakTemplateDeclarations: Yes # å‡½æ•°è°ƒç”¨æ—¶å‚æ•°æ‰“åŒ…å¯¹é½ BinPackArguments: true # å‡½æ•°å£°æ˜æˆ–å®šä¹‰æ—¶æ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦å‚æ•°æ‰“åŒ…å¯¹é½ BinPackParameters: false # å¤§æ‹¬å·çš„å¤„ç†è¡Œä¸º BraceWrapping: AfterClass: false AfterControlStatement: false AfterEnum: false AfterFunction: false AfterNamespace: false AfterObjCDeclaration: false AfterStruct: false AfterUnion: false AfterExternBlock: false BeforeCatch: false BeforeElse: false IndentBraces: false SplitEmptyFunction: true SplitEmptyRecord: true SplitEmptyNamespace: true # The way to wrap binary operators BreakBeforeBinaryOperators: None # The brace breaking style to use BreakBeforeBraces: Attach BreakBeforeInheritanceComma: false # The inheritance list style to use BreakInheritanceList: AfterColon # ä¸‰å…ƒæ“ä½œå·å¯¹é½ BreakBeforeTernaryOperators: true BreakConstructorInitializersBeforeComma: false BreakConstructorInitializers: BeforeColon BreakAfterJavaFieldAnnotations: false # Allow breaking string literals when formatting BreakStringLiterals: true # å…è®¸æ¯è¡Œå­—ç¬¦æœ€å¤§é•¿åº¦ ColumnLimit: 120 CommentPragmas: '^ IWYU pragma:' # æ˜¯å¦å…è®¸å¤šä¸ªnamespaceå£°æ˜åœ¨åŒä¸€è¡Œ CompactNamespaces: false # If the constructor initializers donâ€™t fit on a line, put each initializer on its own line ConstructorInitializerAllOnOneLineOrOnePerLine: true # The number of characters to use for indentation of constructor initializer lists as well as inheritance lists ConstructorInitializerIndentWidth: 4 # Indent width for line continuations ContinuationIndentWidth: 4 Cpp11BracedListStyle: true DerivePointerAlignment: true # ç¦æ­¢ä»£ç æ ¼å¼åŒ– DisableFormat: false ExperimentalAutoDetectBinPacking: false # æ˜¯å¦è‡ªåŠ¨æ·»åŠ namespaceç»“æŸçš„æ³¨é‡Š FixNamespaceComments: true ForEachMacros: - foreach - Q_FOREACH - BOOST_FOREACH # Dependent on the value, multiple #include blocks can be sorted as one and divided based on category IncludeBlocks: Preserve # Regular expressions denoting the different #include categories used for ordering #includes IncludeCategories: - Regex: '^<ext/.*\.h>' Priority: 2 - Regex: '^<.*\.h>' Priority: 1 - Regex: '^<.*' Priority: 2 - Regex: '.*' Priority: 3 IncludeIsMainRegex: '([-_](test|unittest))?$' # content: VSCode Website: https://code.visualstudio.com/ ç®€ä»‹ï¼šThis is the only editor which I used for my develop career since vscode released. Visual Studio Code is a lightweight but powerful source code editor which runs on your desktop and is available for Windows, macOS and Linux. It comes with built-in support for JavaScript, TypeScript and Node.js and has a rich ecosystem of extensions for other languages and runtimes (such as C++, C#, Java, Python, PHP, Go, .NET).

content: Warp Website: https://www.warp.dev/ ç®€ä»‹: The terminal for the 21st century. Modern features for modern development. Warp is a blazingly fast, Rust-based terminal that makes you and your team more productive at running, debugging, and deploying code.

content: ripgrep ( rg ) Website: https://github.com/BurntSushi/ripgrep ç®€ä»‹ï¼š ripgrep is a line-oriented search tool that recursively searches the current directory for a regex pattern. ripgrep is a line-oriented search tool that recursively searches the current directory for a regex pattern. By default, ripgrep will respect gitignore rules and automatically skip hidden files/directories and binary files. (To disable all automatic filtering by default, use rg -uuu.) ripgrep has first class support on Windows, macOS and Linux, with binary downloads available for every release. ripgrep is similar to other popular search tools like The Silver Searcher, ack and grep.

content: Snipaste Website: https://www.snipaste.com/ ç®€ä»‹: Snipaste is a simple but powerful snipping tool, and also allows you to pin the screenshot back onto the screen. You can also convert text or color info in the clipboard into a floating image window. Such windows can be zoomed, rotated, flipped, made translucent, and even made click-through! If you are a programmer, a designer or whoever works much time before the computer, you will be surprised how it can help you get your work done more efficiently!
